text:
This simple SVG file <test.svg>:

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32">
 <rect width="32" height="32"/>
 </svg>

converted with this command (Batik 1.5.1):

  java -jar batik-rasterizer.jar -w 32 -h 32 -m image/png test.svg

does not produce a correct PNG. There is no problem if I specify a width and
height not equal to the values in the viewBox attribute.
creator: 1@c07.de

text: Can you be more specific about what is not correct?
creator: deweese@apache.org
1@c07.de
text:
The example I've given results in a 2x2 pixel square instead of a 32x32 pixel
square. The result seems to be quite random, depending on the content of the
image. Often, it results in a fully transparent image.

Generally, there seem to be problems with the scaling of the image. Most time I
get a smaller version of the expected image in the upper left corner.

Created attachment 12385
Proposed patch for transcoder bug when w/h == viewBox
creator: deweese@apache.org

text: The proposed patch has been applied, and this bug should now be fixed.
creator: deweese@apache.org
